title: A new way of accounts getting hacked?
body:
I had two people on my friendlist who sent a discord link to me and when I asked what it is, they said that it wasn't them sending it. 
This morning, one of them sent the following message: 
"discord link" We hacked this account to send this discord enjoy!
Any idea what this is?

replies.body:
Im glad Riot plan to look into that issue hopefully they solve the origin of the hacks, 
but LeagueFind and the other big servers have nothing to do with it except maybe beeing the main focus of the attacks.
I hope its obviously enoght that the attacks harms more the servers reputation then anything ells.
People need to start to not klick on every link that is sendet to them and 
they will not be so vulnerable to existing security holes in discord.

Yup. LeagueFind was not associated with this message hack exploit. This has been an issue that happened with other servers as well coming from the same person. They can't use your accounts but only send messages to your friend  list. I've seen similar thing before, with random accounts adding me and advertising scam links or boosting sites!
Sounds like someone is trying to frame LeagueFind. I'm an admin for the Leaguefind server and I can assure you all that Leaguefind isn't affiliated with whoever is sending those links

Heya, could I potentially chat with you in-client about this? I'd love to get more details from you about what you know. I'll also reach out to the support team to get the details from the ticket as well. Thank you!

EDIT: nevermind, saw you added me in game already, thanks!

EDIT2: As a follow up for the others watching this thread, I'll be checking out all the information provided and we'll be investigating further. Exploits of any kind are taken very seriously. If anything new pops up, I'll be sure to update the thread again. Thank you for all the help from those reaching out.

Hey guys!

Following up with what [Porocles said earlier](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/lAjQToxn-a-new-way-of-accounts-getting-hacked?comment=0005), I would first start with [reviewing the link around keeping your account safe](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account).

Additionally, I'll be digging into this a bit more from the security side, and will potentially reach out to those that have mentioned being affected. I'll provide more information once I get it, similarly to what I did in a [previous thread](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/0EKbpqq1-discord-invite-hack?show=flat&amp%3Bcomment=000800030000&comment=0008), as this sounds like a similar situation. Follow up response [here as well](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/0EKbpqq1-discord-invite-hack?show=flat&comment=000800030000).

Currently ~~being held against my will~~ participating in a team prioritization meeting that's scheduled for quite a few hours, but I'll get back to this thread and the concerns as soon as I can. Again, thank you for raising this concern!

Hey guys, thanks for this info.  I'm going to forward it to the proper party to check it out.  In the meantime, I recommend [keeping your account safe](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account) and changing your password.  Generally, this is a phishing tactic when an account is compromised.  In this specific case, it's interesting that it leads to a Discord.  Be safe, be wary!

My friend sent me the same message, I clicked the link, joined the server and got insta-kicked. Then a server bot sent me a message:

''Welcome to LeagueFind @you!

In order to access our #looking-for-game channels, please check out the #deleted-channel text channel to see which roles can be self-assigned and use #deleted-channel to add them.

If the pings bother you, note that they can be suppressed in the server's notification settings on the top left of your Discord!''

I never changed any icon to verify my rank or anything in the lines of that, since I never got access to the server. 
Am I screwed or do you think that I'll be fine? My password is very strong.

Yeah, same thing happened to a guy in my friendlist. He sent me a discord link on Monday. 
I didn't click on it because it was random and I'm a little paranoid about getting hacked which is why I  don't click links from people in my friendlist unless I trust them. (good thing I don't). Today he sent me another message just like you said. "discord link" We hacked this account to send this discord enjoy!
Was the discord link "leaguefind" for you too? (Don't click on it, probably not safe)
i clicked on the link and my account got hacked but how are they able to do that i didnt give them any passwords, all i did was change my summenors icon

I am not an expert on this area, but if it's a keylogger, then it's probably done this way:

You download the keylogger via a security hole in Discord just by clicking on the invite link. Maybe there's some kind of loophole in Discord, that enables an attacker to set the discord server's icon to a URL of a specially designed file that is executed to extract the image but actually installs a keylogger as a drive by download attack.

Then they request you to do something in you account like changing the summoner icon, to give you an incentive to log in, which is when they steal your password via the logger. As soon as they have done this, they can use your account to spread the link.

So what do we learn from that: don't click on any links.
I don't know. All I know is that you shouldn't have done that :/

If I understand correctly, the other person went on the discord and got TOLD to change their summoner icon, to get moved into another room or something. I honestly don't understand how that could effect anything though.

OK, so this seems to be happening not for the first time? - seens a forum board with the same issue from two months ago. Would be nice to know where exactly is the flaw. Since changing the password doesn't help if you have keyloggers on your machine, but isn't it possible that Discord itself is vulnerable and people who use the same logins and passwords for both lol and discord are the ones who got compromised here? I know I did this mistake, but since I can't really tell what's what - Riot, please investigate, this is not cool at all. And overall - what's the point to this hack, is it to just make fun of someone?

edit. I didn't get the whole "changing my icon and then getting hacked thing" but, I did change my icon just two or three days ago, when normally i never do that. please tell me this is too stupid to be related
